name: minimum_in_branching_forest
author: 张哲宇
summary: The Minimum In-Branching Forest problem involves finding a subgraph with exactly k edges in a weighted directed graph such that every weakly connected component is an in-branching (an arborescence where all edges point toward the root), and the total edge weight is minimized. The paper presents an efficient O(E log E) algorithm based on priority-based expansion of in-trees, leveraging properties from matroid theory and convex optimization insights.
